item.title: How to ip ban someone from your site -- Very simple
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

[quote=“teh spede, post:5, topic:137617”]S!ms made a good one that could be used better than this…
You just have to right their ip in to a .txt file
:)[/quote]

or a database =)

<?php

$user = "username";
$password = "password";
$database = "site_banned";

mysql_connect(localhost, $user, $password);	
@mysql_select_db($database) or die("Unable to select database");

$query = mysql_query("SELECT * FROM bans");

$array = mysql_fetch_array($query); 

$banned_ips = $array['ips'];

$guests_ip = $_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'];
$ban_wagon = explode(",", $banned_ips);
foreach($ban_wagon as $ip) {
	if($guests_ip == $ip) {
		header("Location: ./banned.html");
	}
}
?>

Read full topic

item.title: How to ip ban someone from your site -- Very simple
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

[quote=“Cyclone, post:1, topic:137617”]Its so simple and i dont know if its been posted

if ($_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] == "12.26.62.76"){ echo "Your banned"; exit; }

12.26.62.76 is the ip… change that to ban them

( Note: This is for a php file )[/quote]S!ms made a good one that could be used better than this…
You just have to right their ip in to a .txt file

i think it has been posted before, and rather than using,

[php]
echo “Your banned”;
exit;
[/php]

its much simpler and better to do…

[php]die(“Your Banned”);[/php]
